cxro.common.device

Interface Device

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    MfDriftMonitorI, Stage

    public interface Device
    Base interface for all devices.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean connect()
      Establish connection to motion subsystem.
      void disconnect()
      Disconnect from motion subsystem.
      java.lang.String getDeviceName()
      Returns the axes given device name.
      boolean isConnected()
      A test if the motion subsystem is connected.
      boolean ping()
      Test device for operational condition.
      boolean reset()
      Reset controller.

    • Method Detail

      • getDeviceName

        java.lang.String getDeviceName()
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the axes given device name.

        The name is a readonly parameter that is used to signify the device name within the individual system.

        Returns:
        Stage device name.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Generic IO exception

      • connect

        boolean connect()
         throws java.io.IOException
        Establish connection to motion subsystem.

        The connection mechanism is not defined here. Rather, it is defined in the concrete, implementation, class.

        Will return false if connection fails; otherwise returns true.

        Returns:
        true if operation succeeds
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Generic IO Exception

      • disconnect

        void disconnect()
         throws java.io.IOException
        Disconnect from motion subsystem.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Generic IO Exception

      • isConnected

        boolean isConnected()
             throws java.io.IOException
        A test if the motion subsystem is connected.

        Most motion commands will return exceptions if the stage is not connected.

        Returns:
        true if connected
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Generic IO exception
        See Also:
        connect(), disconnect()

      • ping

        boolean ping()
      throws java.io.IOException
        Test device for operational condition.

        If is operational, return true. Otherwise return false. Device testing might result in exception with reason message.

        Returns:
        true if operational
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • reset

        boolean reset()
       throws java.io.IOException
        Reset controller.

        Equivalent to a power off/on reset. Use with extreme caution.

        Returns:
        true if successful
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
